p: On the other hand, Peru is a very interesting country to study the impacts of CC on FS, in spite of the fact that it is not a poor country, but rather a low-middle-income country. Peru has notorious social disparities, with a large portion of its population, most of it living in the Andean region, suffering poverty, extreme poverty, and hunger. In addition, the country has many agroecological zones, marked by the presence of an arid coast, the Andes, and the Amazonian rainforest. In this context, we expect a priori heterogeneous impacts of CC that will depend on socio-economic and agroecological contexts.
